title: AgentConfiguration
description:
The full configuration of an agent.

**Summary**

Represents the full configuration of an agent.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)

HalGuru.description:
The header metadata used in the hal.guru agentic process automation platform.

**Summary**

Represents the HalGuru object used for managing configuration and metadata
related to the hal.guru agentic process automation platform.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-halguru

FilePurpose.title: File Purpose
FilePurpose.description:
The purpose of the file.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the description of the HalGuru header. Provides details
regarding the purpose or content of the header in the hal.guru agent context.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-halguru-filepurpose

PlatformVersion.title: Platform Version
PlatformVersion.description:
The version of the hal.guru platform in use.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the version of the hal.guru platform in use. Represents the
platform release currently associated with the agent's configuration.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-halguru-platformversion

PlatformUrl.title: Platform URL
PlatformUrl.description:
The URL of the hal.guru platform.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the URL of the hal.guru platform.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-halguru-platformurl

AutogeneratedAgentUrl.title: Autogenerated Agent URL
AutogeneratedAgentUrl.description:
The autogenerated URL for this agent.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the URL for the automatically generated agent within the hal.guru platform.
This property is intended to store the link associated with the agent's autogenerated metadata.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-halguru-autogeneratedagenturl

Agent.description:
The AI Agent configuration.

**Summary**

Defines a robot agent within the HalGuru Robot framework.
An agent encapsulates properties that specify its identity, functionality, design, and interaction behavior.


**Remarks**

The class captures essential attributes such as the agent's unique identifier, name, type, version,
author details, and description. It also includes configurations for its behavior, startup logic, user-interface design, and themes.
This class facilitates general customization and configuration of robot agents for specific use cases.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent

Id.title: Agent ID
Id.description:
The unique identifier for the agent (GUID ex. 12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012).

**Summary**

Gets or sets the unique identifier for the agent.


**Remarks**

The Id property represents a globally unique identifier (GUID) assigned to the agent.
It is used to uniquely identify the agent within the system and across configurations.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-id

Name.title: Agent Name
Name.description:
The name of the agent.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the name of the robot.


**Remarks**

The Name property specifies the assigned name for the robot in the configuration.
It is used to distinguish the robot in various operational contexts and configurations.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-name

Type.title: Type of the Agent
Type.description:
Represents a basic agent type within the system. This type is generally used for the default or simplest form of agent functionality.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the type of the robot.


**Remarks**

The Type property defines the classification of the robot based on its functionality or purpose.
It is used to identify the operational role of the robot within a system or application.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-type

Version.title: Version of the Agent
Version.description:
The version of the agent.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the version information of the robot.


**Remarks**

The Version property specifies the version of the agent's configuration or implementation.
It can be used to identify and differentiate between various iterations or releases of the agent.
Version should be in the format: Major.Minor[.Patch] or GitVersionInfo
It’s common practice to prefix your version names with the letter v.
Some good tag names might be v1.0.0 or v2.3.4.
If the tag isn’t meant for production use, add a pre-release version after the version name.
Some good pre-release versions might be v0.2.0-alpha or v5.9-beta.3.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-version

Description.title: Description of the Agent
Description.description:
The description of the agent.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the description of the robot.


**Remarks**

The Description property provides detailed information about the robot,
including its purpose, functionality, or any additional metadata relevant
to its usage and operational context.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-description

Author.title: Author of the Agent
Author.description:
Represents an author entity with metadata about an individual or organization.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the author information of the robot.


**Remarks**

The Author property provides metadata about the creator or maintainer of the robot.
It includes details such as the author's name, email, URL, company, and copyright information.
This information can be used for tracking and attribution purposes.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author

Name.title: Author Name
Name.description:
The name of the author.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the name of the author.


**Remarks**

The name may represent the full name of an individual author or the name of an organization.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author-name

Email.title: Contact Email
Email.description:
The email address of the author.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the email address of the author.


**Remarks**

The email address can be used for communication or identification purposes
in various contexts related to the author's metadata.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author-email

Url.title: URL
Url.description:
The URL associated with the author.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the URL associated with the author.


**Remarks**

The URL may link to the author's personal website, portfolio, or other relevant online resource.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author-url

Company.title: Company
Company.description:
The company associated with the author.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the company associated with the author.


**Remarks**

This property represents the name of the organization or business the author is affiliated with.
It may provide contextual information about the author's professional background or association.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author-company

Copyright.title: Copyright
Copyright.description:
The copyright information associated with the author or their works.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the copyright information associated with the author or their works.


**Remarks**

This property specifies the legal rights and protections claimed by the author or organization for their intellectual property.
It is typically represented by a notice specifying the year(s) of creation and the owner of the copyright.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-author-copyright

Start.title: Agent Start Configuration
Start.description:
Represents the start configuration for a robot.
This class defines the initial setup or parameters required when the robot is initiated.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the starting configuration for the robot.


**Remarks**

The Start property defines the initial execution parameters or actions
that the robot will perform. It includes details such as the connector,
initial prompt, or messages necessary to initialize the robot's operation.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-start

LlmConnectorName.title: LLM Connector Name
LlmConnectorName.description:
Name of the LLM connector to be used from the LlmConnectors list.

**Summary**

Specifies the identifier of the LLM connector to be used from the LlmConnectors list.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-start-llmconnectorname

PromptName.description:
Name of the prompt to be used during the agent's initialization process.

**Summary**

Represents the identifier of the prompt to be used during the agent's initialization process.
This identifier is used to set the specific prompt from the configuration in the session.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-start-promptname

Url.description:
URL associated with the start configuration of the agent.

**Summary**

Specifies a URL associated with the start configuration of the agent.
Ensures the value conforms to a valid URL format.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-start-url

Themes.title: Agent Themes
Themes.description:
The collection of themes and their associated designs for the agent.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the collection of themes and their associated designs for the agent.


**Remarks**

The Themes property maps a to its corresponding .
This allows the agent to support multiple UI themes, such as Light and Dark, with customizable designs.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes

items.description:
Represents a design configuration for a specific theme,
which may include settings related to chat appearance or other customizable elements.

Theme.title: Theme
Theme.description:
Represents the theme options available for a robot's display or functionality settings.
Provides a selection of predefined appearance modes, designed to meet various
user preferences and environment requirements.

**Summary**

Specifies the active theme for the design configuration, indicating the appearance mode being applied.


**Remarks**

This property defines the visual theme utilized in the application's interface, such as or .
It is integral for determining the aesthetic representation and adapting the user interface to different contexts or preferences.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-theme

Messages.title: Messages (Theme Design)
Messages.description:
Chat message themes associated with the theme design.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of static messages associated with an agent, used for quick access within the system.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-messages-list

items.description:
Represents the visual theme for a chat message, including settings for icon appearance
and text or background colors. This class defines customization properties that control
the overall design of individual chat messages.

MessageType.title: Message Type
MessageType.description:
Represents the type of a chat message in the system.
Used to categorize messages based on their source or purpose.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the type of the chat message.
Represents the category of the message, such as User, Agent, System, Busy, Error, or Owner.
Determines the specific role or source associated with the message.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-messagetype

IconCssClass.title: Icon CSS Class
IconCssClass.description:
The CSS class for the icon displayed in the user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the CSS class for the icon displayed in the user interface.
This property is typically used to specify the appearance or styling
of the icon for the light theme.
See: https://fontawesome.com/icons


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-iconcssclass

IconColor.title: Icon Color
IconColor.description:
The color for the icon displayed in the user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the color for the icon displayed in the user interface.
This property is typically used to define the color of the icon
for the light theme.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-iconcolor

IconUrl.title: Icon URL
IconUrl.description:
The URL for the icon displayed in the user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the URL for the icon displayed in the user interface.
This property is typically used to define the path to the icon
image resource for the light theme.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-iconurl

BackgroundColor.title: Background Color
BackgroundColor.description:
The background color for the user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the background color for the user interface.
This property is typically used to define the primary background color
for the light theme within the application.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-backgroundcolor

TextColor.title: Text Color
TextColor.description:
The text color displayed in the user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the text color displayed in the user interface.
This property is typically used to define the color of text
elements for the light theme.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-themes-list-messages-list-textcolor

UI.title: Agent User Interface
UI.description:
Represents the design configuration for an agent's user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the user interface design configuration for the robot.


**Remarks**

The UserInterface property defines the visual interface design elements for the robot.
It specifies configurations such as button behavior and appearance,
enabling customized user interactions based on the defined design settings.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-ui

DisableCloseButton.title: Disable Close Button
DisableCloseButton.description:
Indicates whether the close button should be disabled.

**Summary**

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the close button should be disabled.
If set to true, the close button will not be displayed or functional.
This can be used in specific themes to prevent the user from closing the interface.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-ui-disableclosebutton

Features.title: Agent Features
Features.description:
Defines the configurable properties that determine how an agent operates during its execution.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the features and capabilities of the agent.


**Remarks**

The Features property defines the specific functional attributes and
operational parameters of the robot. It encapsulates the settings that govern
behavior such as URL checks, validation logic, and retry attempts.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features

CheckAllUrls.title: Check all URLs
CheckAllUrls.description:
Determines whether all URLs exist and are valid in the generated answer.

**Summary**

Indicates whether all URLs exist and are valid in the generated answer.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-checkallurls

CheckIsAnswerCorrect.title: Check answer
CheckIsAnswerCorrect.description:
Determines whether the answer provided is evaluated as correct.

**Summary**

Determines whether the answer provided is evaluated as correct.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-checkisanswercorrect

CheckIsLastUrlCorrectAnswer.title: Check last URL
CheckIsLastUrlCorrectAnswer.description:
Determines whether the last URL in the provided collection is the correct answer.

**Summary**

Determines whether the last URL in the provided collection is the correct answer.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-checkislasturlcorrectanswer

CommentCurrentUrl.title: Comment current URL
CommentCurrentUrl.description:
Determines whether the robot should comment the current URL.

**Summary**

Indicates whether the robot should comment the current URL.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-commentcurrenturl

PerChannelThreading.title: Per channel threading
PerChannelThreading.description:
Determines whether a separate thread is created for each channel.

**Summary**

Determines whether a separate thread is created for each channel.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-perchannelthreading

MaxRetryAttempts.title: Retry on failure
MaxRetryAttempts.description:
Determines whether the robot should retry the check fails.

**Summary**

Indicates whether the robot should retry the check fails.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-agent-features-maxretryattempts

Operator.description:
The AI Agent configuration.

**Summary**

Represents the configuration for an AI operator within the HalGuru platform,
containing key information such as name and user interface details.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-operator

Name.title: Agent Name
Name.description:
The name of the operator.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the name of the operator.


**Remarks**

The Name property specifies the identifier for the operator, commonly used to label and distinguish
the operator within various operational and configuration contexts.
This property enforces constraints on the length of the name to ensure compliance with system requirements.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-operator-name

UI.title: Operator User Interface
UI.description:
Defines the design configuration and personalized settings for an operator's user interface.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the user interface design configuration for the operator.


**Remarks**

The UI property specifies the design and configuration settings
related to the operator's user interface. This property facilitates
defining the operator's visual interaction elements, user experience customizations,
and general UI-related features tailored to specific operational requirements.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-operator-ui

Features.title: Operator Features
Features.description:
Defines the configurable properties that determine how an operator operates during its execution.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the features and capabilities of the operator.


**Remarks**

The Features property represents the configurable attributes and functionalities
of the operator. It defines the operator's behavior and operational characteristics
during execution, enabling customization for specific tasks or workflows.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-operator-features

Messages.description: Static messages used for quick access within the system.

items.description: Defines a static message and its associated metadata for an agent.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: The name of the static message for the agent.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Content of the static message for the agent.

Prompts.description:
Prompts available within the agent's configuration.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of prompts available within the agent's configuration,
which can be utilized for setting or retrieving pre-defined instructions in various workflows.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-prompts-list

items.description: Represents a prompt model containing a name and the associated prompt text.

Name.description:
The name of the prompt.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the name associated with the prompt.
The name must be at least 6 and at most 20 characters long.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-prompts-list-name

Prompt.description:
The text content of the prompt.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the text associated with the prompt.
This property represents the descriptive or detailed text content.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-prompts-list-prompt

LlmConnectors.description:
LLM connector configurations.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of LLM (Large Language Model) connector configurations.
Provides settings and parameters for multiple LLM connectors, allowing customization
of model behaviors and API integrations within an agent configuration.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list

items.description: Represents a configuration object for connecting to a Large Language Model (LLM) provider.

Name.description:
Represents the name assigned to the LLM Connector configuration.

**Summary**

Represents the name assigned to the LLM Connector configuration.


**Remarks**

This property is used to identify the specific configuration instance,
and can be utilized for organizational or reference purposes.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-name

LlmProvider.description:
Represents an enum value for the DeepSeek provider in the LlmProvider enumeration.

**Summary**

Specifies the large language model (LLM) provider to be used by the LLM Connector.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-llmprovider

Model.description:
Specifies the model identifier to use within the LLM Connector instance.

**Summary**

Specifies the model identifier to use within the LLM Connector instance.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-model

Temperature.description:
Specifies the randomness of responses generated by the language model,
with lower values resulting in less random outputs and higher
values increasing creativity and variability.

**Summary**

Specifies the randomness of responses generated by the language model,
with lower values resulting in less random outputs and higher
values increasing creativity and variability.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-temperature

MaxTokens.description:
Specifies the maximum number of tokens the model will generate in its response.

**Summary**

Specifies the maximum number of tokens the model will generate in its response.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-maxtokens

AssistantId.description:
Identifies the specific assistant model or instance used within the LLM connection.

**Summary**

Identifies the specific assistant model or instance used within the LLM connection.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-assistantid

VectorStoreId.description:
Identifier for the associated vector store.

**Summary**

Identifier for the associated vector store.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-vectorstoreid

ApiKey.description:
Represents the API key used to authenticate with the LLM provider.

**Summary**

Represents the API key used to authenticate with the LLM provider.


**Remarks**

This property stores the authentication key required for accessing services provided by the
specified LLM provider. Ensure that this key is managed securely and complies with best practices
for sensitive information handling.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-apikey

InstructionsPrompt.description:
Specifies the custom instructions or contextual guidance provided to the LLM for tailoring its responses.

**Summary**

Specifies the custom instructions or contextual guidance provided to the LLM for tailoring its responses.


**Remarks**

This property allows setting predefined prompts or guidelines that influence the behavior and tone of the LLM's output.
It can be used to define specific tasks, roles, or response formats for the model.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-instructionsprompt

Tools.description:
Represents a collection of tools or additional functionalities associated with the LLM connection.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of tools or additional functionalities associated with the LLM connection.


**Remarks**

This property holds a list of tool identifiers or names that extend or complement the capabilities
of the LLM. These tools can be used to enhance interactions, provide additional processing, or
implement custom logic during the LLM's operation.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-tools

ApiUrl.description:
Represents the base URL of the API used to connect to the Large Language Model (LLM) provider.

**Summary**

Represents the base URL of the API used to connect to the Large Language Model (LLM) provider.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-llmconnectors-list-apiurl

Secrets.description:
Key-value pairs used to store sensitive information.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of key-value pairs used to store sensitive information
such as passwords, API keys, or other private data required for the agent's operations.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-secrets-list

items.description: Represents a key-value pair used for storing sensitive information in an agent's configuration.

Key.title: Secret Key
Key.description:
The name of the secret key.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the name associated with the agent secret.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-secrets-list-key

Secret.title: Secret Value
Secret.description:
The value of the secret key.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the secret key associated with the agent.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-secrets-list-secret

State.description:
The state of the agent.

**Summary**

Represents the current operational state and associated metadata of the agent as part of its configuration.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-state

oneOf.description: Defines the operational state and associated metadata for a session of an agent.

Started.title: Started
Started.description: The moment when the agent AI is initiated.

IsStarted.title: Is Started
IsStarted.description: Indicates whether the agent has been started.

ThreadId.title: Thread Id
ThreadId.description: The identifier of the thread associated with the agent.

LlmConnectorName.title: LLM Connector Name
LlmConnectorName.description: The name of the LLM connector associated with the agent.

PromptName.title: Prompt Name
PromptName.description: The name of the currently active prompt associated with the agent.

Url.title: Url
Url.description: The URL associated with the agent state.

Language.title: Language
Language.description: The language associated with the agent state.

Description.description: A brief description or details regarding the agent state.

Variables.description: A collection of variables associated with the agent state.

TestCases.description:
Test cases for validating the behavior of an agent.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of test cases for validating the behavior of an agent.
Each test is defined as a key-value pair where the key is the test's unique name,
and the value is an object that defines the test's details.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-testcases-list

items.description: Represents a test case for validating an agent's response to a given input.

Name.title: Test Name
Name.description:
The name of the test case.

**Summary**

The name of the test case.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-testcases-list-name

QuestionMessage.title: Question Message
QuestionMessage.description:
The question or input message directed to the agent.

**Summary**

The question or input message directed to the agent for evaluation within the test.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-testcases-list-questionmessage

AnswerMessageContains.title: Answer Message Contains
AnswerMessageContains.description:
A list of substrings that the output message is expected to contain.

**Summary**

A list of substrings that the response message from the agent is expected to contain.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-testcases-list-answermessagecontains

AnswerMessageRegex.title: Answer Message Regex
AnswerMessageRegex.description:
A regular expression pattern that the agent's response should conform to.

**Summary**

A regular expression pattern that the agent's response is expected to match.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-testcases-list-answermessageregex

ExampleMessages.description:
Example messages that demonstrate input-output interactions for an agent.

**Summary**

Represents a collection of example messages that demonstrate input-output interactions
for an agent within the system.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-examplemessages-list

items.description: Represents an example message used for interactions by a robot.

Input.description:
Gets or sets the message provided as input by the user.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the message provided as input by the user.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-examplemessages-list-input

Output.description:
Gets or sets the response message generated by the service.

**Summary**

Gets or sets the response message generated by the service.


Manual: https://docs.hal.guru/models/(halguru)-examplemessages-list-output
